ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I'd describe the seminar as an in-depth overview of the United States in the twentieth century, with attention to political, labor, cultural and transnational/international history. The course provides a nice synthesis of class texts and new works. I would definitely recommend the course to other students, as the seminar environment is lively and you come out well prepared for an orals field in the 20th century.
I would highly recommend this course to anyone studying 20th century US history.

I would summarize this course as an intense introduction to major topics in 20th century American history. I would tell any student considering the course that it will give them a broad overview as well as exposure to major historiographical issues. I would definitely recommend this course to any student who is looking to get a good grounding in American historiography or is considering doing an orals field in 20th century American history.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course increased my knowledge of US history and historiography by leaps and bounds. I can't state enough how helpful this was for orals prep. We covered a lot of ground, so didn't get much depth in any one subject, but all of the books we read provided good leads and footnotes for any further research.
